content.raw: Nate's implementation is more generic and fits the concept of a graph better while the current implementation is essentially a tree. Later on I wonder if it make sense to make Hugo's implementation derive from Nate's and override the `FrameGraph::Path` function to perform faster tree traversal. The current implementation also has useful functionalities for understanding path strings but various parts will require refactoring to make things work together.
